climbs.name: Venus
climbs.fa: John Long, Joe Kristy, & Kelly Corcorran

content.description: Climb up the right prow. A bouldery start on a steep face leads to easier climbing and a final bulge made easier by hidden jugs.
content.location: right side of the face at the prow.

content.description: Steep and pumpy, this is a great introduction to the harder routes on this aspect of the tower. Climb up the gently overhung wall on sustained 5.10 moves until the angle lessens before the anchors.
content.location: Center of the south face of Mt. Olympus.

climbs.name: Pluto
climbs.fa: John Long, Joe Kristy, & Kelly Corcorran

content.description: Climb straight up to a big cobble before moving to the right and over a small bulge. Continue up the vertical headwall to the anchors. This climb should clean up with more ascents.
content.location: This route begins from a belay station in the gully below the approach trail, on the right (south) side of the tower.

climbs.name: Medusa
climbs.fa: John Long, Joe Kristy, & Kelly Corcorran

content.description: Climb a juggy face up to and over a flake bulge before stepping right and continuing up the vertical face above. Interesting, fun climbing.
content.location: Northwest shoulder of Mt. Olympus, right of the left trending ramp.

climbs.name: Mars
climbs.fa: John Long, Joe Kristy, & Kelly Corcoran

content.description: Begin climbing diagonally slightly right to left up to and over the crux bulge, before tackling the steep cobbles above. Very popular.
content.location: Begin on the bolt line slightly left of center on the uphill side (west face) of Mt. Olympus.

content.description: Begin twenty feet down the gully from "Hercules," on the downhill side of the cave. Climb up to and then pass the cave on its right side. Continue up the steep face above the cave, moving left to the anchors.
content.location: The right most (downhill) route on the south side of the tower. Twenty feet right of "Hercules" at the right side of the cave.

climbs.name: Hercules
climbs.fa: John Long, Joe Kristy, & Kelly Corcorran

content.description: Stem across to the 1st bolt and then climb over instant exposure existing due to Hercules' Cave. From here fight the pump clock as you crank past sustained moves on the long steep face. Some funky clips, but well protected. The best route on Mt. Olympus.
content.location: Begins in the center of the wall, left of the cave.

content.description: Begin climbing the line of large cobbles slightly right of the center of the face. The route looks harder than it is as the route contains many juggy holds.
content.location: The line of bolts slightly right of the center of the west face.

content.description: Begin slightly downhill and left of the approach. Climb a juggy face left, following the ramp. Continue up the knobby face to the summit.
content.protection: 2 bolts & 2-bolt anchor. This is NOT a sport bolted route!
content.location: Downhill and left of the descent trail. Began below a left trending ramp. On the northwest shoulder of Mt. Olympus.

climbs.name: Argus
climbs.fa: John Long, Joe Kristy, & Kelly Corcorran

content.description: Stem up the groove in the steep face, on large cobbles. Climb past three bolts followed by steep moves on big cobbles.
content.location: Center line of bolts on the west face.
